metadata.title: CVE-2014-9038 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
wp-includes/http.php in WordPress before 3.7.5, 3.8.x before 3.8.5, 3.9.xbefore 3.9.3, and 4.x before 4.0.1 allows remote attackers to conductserver-side request forgery (SSRF) attacks by referring to a 127.0.0.0/8resource.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9038` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfifteen - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfourteen - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentythirteen - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.1+dfsg-1').
